title: India's Fixtures In 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series In England, New Zealand; BGT At Home - News18
summary:
India's Fixtures in the 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series in England, New Zealand; BGT at Home

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

India will compete in the fourth edition of the World Test Championship (WTC) starting in 2025, hosting various teams and tackling significant away series.

  • India will face West Indies, South Africa, and Australia at home.
  • The team will travel to England, Sri Lanka, and New Zealand for away series.
  • India's first series in the new WTC cycle begins with a five-match Test series in England from June 20, 2025.
  • India's last series of this cycle will be against Australia at home in early 2027.
After a disappointing end to the 2023-25 WTC cycle, Team India is expected to see many changes before starting the new campaign in June.

India's roadmap for the WTC 2025-27 cycle sets the stage for exciting cricket, as they look to regain their footing after previous losses.
newTitle: India's Fixtures in the 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series in England, New Zealand; BGT at Home

Agarawal's hot streak continues; Haryana, Punjab, Bengal and TN in knockouts - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Agarawal's Hot Streak Leads Karnataka to Knockouts in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: January 9, 2024 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Mayank Agarawal continued his impressive form, scoring his fourth List A century as Karnataka secured a spot in the knockouts of the 2024-25 Vijay Hazare Trophy. Haryana, Punjab, Bengal, and Tamil Nadu also made it through, with notable performances across the teams.

  • Karnataka tops Group C with a one-wicket win over Punjab.
  • Mumbai, winners of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, failed to reach the knockouts.
  • Punjab finished as the best second-ranked team thanks to standout performances by Prabhsimran Singh.
  • Gujarat and Vidarbha are the only teams with an all-win record in the group stage.
“His performance has been crucial for the team,” praised the commentator about Agarawal.

As the tournament progresses, the knockouts are scheduled to begin, showcasing the competitive spirit among the teams in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
newTitle: Agarawal's Hot Streak Leads Karnataka to Knockouts in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Published on: October 2023, Source: Times of India

In an impressive display of cricket, Shan Masood and Babar Azam have made history by registering a new record for Pakistan in their match against South Africa.

  • Masood scored a remarkable century, leading the team to a commanding position.

'Reset, avoid on-field battles': AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice - The Times of India
summary:
AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Following a challenging tour of Australia, AB de Villiers has shared critical advice with his friend Virat Kohli, who faced difficulties in his batting performance, particularly against deliveries outside off-stump, leading to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli struggled with his form in the recent series, scoring only 190 runs over nine innings.
  • His performance included an average of 23.75, with a single century in the first Test.
  • De Villiers highlighted the need for Kohli to reset his mindset and avoid on-field battles during tough times.
  • Kohli's significant challenges in the ongoing 2024-25 Test season were also discussed, where he has only managed 382 runs in 10 matches.
  • De Villiers acknowledged Kohli's fighting spirit but urged him to refocus after every ball.
“...it is best to get rid of those things. As a batter, it is to reset every single and realize every ball is an event and just forget about the bowler.” - AB de Villiers

In conclusion, AB de Villiers believes that a mental reset will be crucial for Kohli to regain his form and contribute effectively to the team.
newTitle: AB de Villiers advises Virat Kohli to reset his mindset after tough Australia tour

title: First club make Dani Olmo move as Man City and Arsenal eye free deal for Barcelona star - The Mirror
summary:
Dani Olmo Targeted by AC Milan, Arsenal and Man City Eye Free Transfer

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Mirror

The article discusses the interest from AC Milan in signing Dani Olmo, who is currently registered with Barcelona but facing difficulties due to La Liga's wage restrictions. Both Arsenal and Manchester City are also considering a move for Olmo.

  • AC Milan has made a move to sign Dani Olmo on a short-term basis.
  • Olmo transferred to Barcelona in the summer but may not be registered due to financial constraints.
  • Arsenal and Manchester City are interested in a free transfer, as Barcelona struggles with financial regulations.
  • Olmo had a strong start to the season before an injury interrupted his performance.
  • Milan is willing to match Olmo's current wages for a six-month deal.
“Will Barcelona win their Dani Olmo battle? Have your say in the comments section”

This situation highlights the ongoing financial struggles of Barcelona and the potential opportunity for other clubs to acquire Olmo without a transfer fee.
newTitle: Dani Olmo Targeted by AC Milan, Arsenal and Man City Eye Free Transfer

Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria - Chess.com
summary:
Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries His Queen Ella Victoria

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Chess.com

Magnus Carlsen has married Ella Victoria Malone in a beautiful ceremony held at Holmenkollen Chapel in Oslo, attended by close family and friends.

  • The couple exchanged vows in a snowy setting on a sunny winter day.
  • The lavish reception took place at the iconic Grand Hotel in Oslo.
  • Notable guests included Carlsen's best men and prominent figures from the chess community.
  • A film crew from Netflix attended, possibly filming for a upcoming chess-related show.
  • Ella Victoria Carlsen has been transitioning into a more public role, attending various chess events with Carlsen.

“Sometimes it's difficult to come with him to these tournaments, but I do it anyway because I want to be a good girlfriend and support him, and it's something I'm getting used to.”
—Ella Victoria Malone

This marriage signifies a new chapter in both their lives, with Ella expected to play a more central role in Magnus' career.
newTitle: Chess King Magnus Carlsen Marries Ella Victoria Malone

title: Vidya Balan & Farhan Akhtar's public show of support for Rohit Sharma sparks buzz of PR campaign - ThePrint
summary:
Vidya Balan & Farhan Akhtar's Public Support for Rohit Sharma Raises PR Campaign Speculations

Publication Date: New Delhi

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma’s decision to skip the final Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy has drawn praise from celebrities Vidya Balan and Farhan Akhtar, although their supportive posts have sparked speculation of a PR campaign.

  • Rohit Sharma's decision to sit out was praised as courageous and selfless.
  • Both Vidya Balan and Farhan Akhtar posted similar messages on social media, which raised eyebrows.
  • There are rumors regarding Sharma's potential retirement from Test cricket.
  • Sharma stated that his decision is based on performance issues and has clarified that he is not retiring.
“I have stood down from this Test but I am not going anywhere.” - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, while the public support from Bollywood celebrities appears significant, it also raises questions about the nature of their endorsements amid ongoing speculation about Sharma's future in cricket.
newTitle: Vidya Balan & Farhan Akhtar's Public Support for Rohit Sharma Raises PR Campaign Speculations

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli OUT, Mohammed Shami RETURNS: India's Best Playing XI For WTC 2025-27 Cycle - Times Now
summary:
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli OUT, Mohammed Shami RETURNS: India's Best Playing XI For WTC 2025-27 Cycle

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times Now

India's Test cricket team faces significant changes following their defeat against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024, resulting in their failure to qualify for the WTC final for the first time. The upcoming cycle demands a fresh approach with potential exclusions of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from the lineup.

Key Points:

  • India lost the 2024 Border-Gavaskar Trophy 1-3 against Australia.
  • This marks the first time India will not play in the WTC final.
  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's futures in Test cricket are in question.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal and KL Rahul are expected to be the main openers.
  • Sarfaraz Khan may replace Kohli at no. 4, with Rishabh Pant as wicketkeeper.
  • Mohammed Shami returns as a key pace option, backed by Jasprit Bumrah.
“It will not be a surprise if Virat and Rohit are excluded from the team's plans for the longest format in the near future.”

The new lineup aims to rejuvenate India’s Test cricket squad as they prepare for the challenges of the upcoming WTC cycle.
newTitle: India's Best Playing XI for WTC 2025-27 Cycle

title: Amid Retirement Claims, Virat Kohli Gets Brutal Reality Check: "Even Sachin Tendulkar..." - NDTV Sports
summary:
Virat Kohli Faces Criticism Following India's Defeat in Sydney Test

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team suffered a significant loss against Australia, raising questions about senior player Virat Kohli’s performance. Irfan Pathan criticized Kohli’s batting average, suggesting that a new player could contribute equally.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and its chance to qualify for the World Test Championship final.
  • Irfan Pathan highlighted Kohli's struggles, averaging only 15 in 2024's first innings.
  • Pathan called for a shift from 'superstar culture' to a more team-focused approach in Indian cricket.
  • Jasprit Bumrah noted that the young players gained valuable experience despite the setback.
“We are not degrading Virat Kohli... it takes hard work to rectify that mistake.” - Irfan Pathan

The critical response aimed at Kohli emphasizes the need for accountability and performance in high-stakes sports.

title: Virat Kohli receives massive verdict from ‘sad’ Pat Cummins: ‘Bit of theatre, sometimes it can rile you up’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pat Cummins Praises Virat Kohli Amid Retirement Speculations

Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the recent defeat of India against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, highlighting the performances of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Pat Cummins, the Australian captain, reflects on Kohli's impact on the game and expresses sadness over the potential of it being Kohli's last series.

  • India lost the fifth Test match, finishing the series 1-3 against Australia.
  • Virat Kohli scored a century in the first Test but struggled in subsequent matches.
  • Pat Cummins praised Kohli, saying it would be sad if this is his last series.
  • Rohit Sharma’s form has been under scrutiny, missing one test and struggling with scores.
“It will be sad if it’s his last series,” said Pat Cummins.

In conclusion, Kohli's future in the Test team is uncertain, but his contributions to cricket, especially against formidable opponents like Australia, are highly regarded.
newTitle: Pat Cummins Praises Virat Kohli Amid Retirement Speculations

Australia's skipper Pat Cummins praised India’s Virat Kohli, expressing sadness over the possibility of it being Kohli's last series. He noted the competitive nature of their contests and highlighted Kohli's theatrical presence in cricket.

title: India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
summary:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they hadn't held for eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

India's shortcomings both in batting consistency and strategic decisions ultimately led to their defeat in the prestigious Border Gavaskar Trophy series.
newTitle: India loses Border Gavaskar Trophy due to batting failures despite Bumrah's heroics

Saim Ayub to travel to London for ankle fracture treatment - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Saim Ayub to travel to London for ankle fracture treatment

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Pakistan opener Saim Ayub is set to undergo treatment in London for an ankle fracture sustained during a Test match in Cape Town. The decision by the PCB to expedite his treatment comes amid past criticisms of their handling of player injuries.

  • Saim Ayub suffered an ankle injury during the second Test against South Africa.
  • The PCB has sent him to London for immediate specialist treatment instead of waiting for the end of the Test.
  • Assistant coach Azhar Mahood will accompany Ayub on his journey.
  • PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi assured that Ayub will receive care at a top hospital.
  • Ayub is expected to miss six weeks of play, risking his participation in the upcoming Champions Trophy.
"All resources will be used for his treatment." - PCB statement

This incident illustrates the PCB's commitment to improving their approach to player injuries, aiming for a more proactive and immediate response to such situations.
newTitle: Saim Ayub to travel to London for ankle fracture treatment

summary:
India's Likely XI For 1st T20I vs England: Bumrah and Jaiswal Out, Pandya In

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times Now

As the Border-Gavaskar Trophy concludes, India prepares for a T20I series against England, focusing on the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 and the T20 World Cup 2026.

  • India's squad for the T20I series remains unannounced, expected to resemble the team from the South Africa tour.
  • Suryakumar Yadav is confirmed as the captain of the T20I side.
  • Key players like Sanju Samson and Tilak Varma, who performed well in South Africa, are likely starters.
  • Jasprit Bumrah will miss the series due to injury, and Ruturaj Gaikwad may be selected for his performance.
  • India's likely XI includes Ruturaj Gaikwad, Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav (C), along with Hardik Pandya and others.

“India's Likely XI For 1st T20I vs England: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav (C), Rinku Singh, Hardik Pandya, Jitesh Sharma/Ramandeep Singh, Axar Patel, Varun Chakravarthy, Arshdeep Singh, Prasidh Krishna.”

The upcoming series represents a crucial moment for India's T20 preparations ahead of major tournaments.
